results.title: In Charleston, a Museum Honors a Journey of Grief and Grace
results.abstract: The International African American Museum, in a former slave port, is about more than slavery. It’s about survival and resilience.

media.caption: The International African American Museum in Charleston, S.C., is set on the site of the former Gadsden’s Wharf, overlooking Charleston Harbor, where tens of thousands of enslaved Africans first entered the United States. It conjures the image of a boat in dry dock.
media.copyright: Leslie Ryann McKellar for The New York Times

results.title: Sheldon Harnick, ‘Fiddler on the Roof’ Lyricist, Dies at 99
results.abstract: His collaborations with the composer Jerry Bock also included “Fiorello!” — which, like “Fiddler,” was a Tony winner — and “She Loves Me.”

media.caption: The lyricist Sheldon Harnick in 2015. He gave voice to a broad range of characters, including starry-eyed young lovers, corrupt politicians and struggling Jews in early-20th-century Russia.
media.copyright: Chad Batka for The New York Times
